intro: Panax macgillivrayi, commonly known as the MacGillivray ginseng, is a rare and endangered species native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain the seeds, and it thrives in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is critically endangered and protected in several regions.
